nodes.bodyText: is it possible to merge the two if checks to one and do an early return?
Can merge. But it'd still be the same I guess
Do we need to explicitly call the super method here?
Ah no. This is a piece of IDE generated code. Left it as-is so that we'll easily know if this is something that we need to support.
I guess we can remove these type of overridden methods

Can we check the node-kind and get the symbol?
Checking instanceof can be expensive, and we won't have to introduce another interface also.

If checking the node kind, we'll have to handle each node with a symbol separately. What I have done here is, introduce an API for getting/setting a symbol to a node (currently we don't have a unified API for accessing a symbol from a node). So any node which has a symbol associated to it implements this interface and at this point, once I find the node enclosing the specified position, I just simply call getSymbol() to get the symbol. No need to consider the nodes individually.

+1 go with this for the initial version. But IMO we should remove instanceof checks in all places.
For e.g.: since the NodeResolver is already a visitor, if we can return the symbol directly rather than doing it in two-steps, then we can avoid these checks.

The performance of instanceof check isn't an issue in Java 8 right?
Made it a generic node resolving visitor in case we need similar behaviours for other APIs. +1 for making it return the symbol itself according how this progresses
